Post, in HTML format

Multiple ways to include content

Why use Grunt? The Grunt ecosystem is huge and it's growing every day. With literally hundreds of plugins to choose from, you can use Grunt to automate just about anything with a minimum of effort. If someone hasn't already built what you need, authoring and publishing your own Grunt plugin to npm is a breeze.

{{md}} helper

Code

Inline code

To include code (formatted in monospace font), you can either surround inline code with a single backtick (</code>): <code>some code</code></p></p> <pre><code class="lang-md">some code`

Indented code

Or indent several lines of code by at least four spaces, as in:

// Some comments
line 1 of code
line 2 of code
line 3 of code

Code "fences"

Or wrap the code with backtick "fences" before and after the code: </code></p> <pre><code class="lang-md">line 1 of code line 2 of code line 3 of code</code></pre> <h4>Code highlighting</h4> <p>GFM, or &quot;GitHub Flavored Markdown&quot; also supports syntax highlighting. To activate it, simply add the file extension of the language you want to use directly after the first &quot;fence&quot;: <code> js 

assemble: {
  // Files to build into pages
  pages: {
    src:  'templates/pages/*.hbs',
    dest: 'dist/'
  }
}

{{include}} helper

A third way to "include" content.
